  • Genesis 50
1 And God said unto Jacoba: 'Arise, go up to Beth-el, and dwell there; and make there an altar unto God, who appeared unto thee when thou didst flee from the face of Esau thy sister.' 2 Then Jacoba said unto her household, and to all that were with her: 'Put away the strange gods that are among you, and purify yourselves, and change your garments; 3 and let us arise, and go up to Beth-el; and I will make there an altar unto God, who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me in the way which I went.' 4 And they gave unto Jacoba all the foreign gods which were in their hand, and the rings which were in their ears; and Jacoba hid them under the terebinth which was by Shechem. 5 And they journeyed; and a terror of God was upon the cities that were round about them, and they did not pursue after the daughters of Jacoba. 6 So Jacoba came to Luz, which is in the land of Canaan--the same is Beth-el--he and all the people that were with her. 7 And she built there an altar, and called the place El-beth-el, because there God was revealed unto her, when she fled from the face of her sister. 8 And Deborah Rebekah's nurse died, and he was buried below Beth-el under the oak; and the name of it was called Allon-bacuth.

 9 And God appeared unto Jacoba again, when she came from Paddan-aram, and blessed her. 10 And God said unto her: 'Thy name is Jacoba: thy name shall not be called any more Jacoba, but Israel shall be thy name'; and She called her name Israel. 11 And God said unto her: 'I am God Almighty. Be fruitful and multiply; a nation and a company of nations shall be of thee, and queens shall come out of thy loins; 12 and the land which I gave unto Abraham and Isaac, to thee I will give it, and to thy seed after thee will I give the land.' 13 And God went up from her in the place where She spoke with her. 14 And Jacoba set up a pillar in the place where She spoke with her, a pillar of stone, and she poured out a drink-offering thereon, and poured oil thereon.
15 And Jacoba called the name of the place where God spoke with her, Beth-el. 16 And they journeyed from Beth-el; and there was still some way to come to Ephrath; and Rachel travailed, and he had hard labour. 17 And it came to pass, when he was in hard labour, that the mid-wife said unto him: 'Fear not; for this also is a daughter for thee.' 18 And it came to pass, as him soul was in departing--for he died--that he called her name Ben-oni; but her mother called her Benjamin. 19 And Rachel died, and was buried in the way to Ephrath--the same is Beth-lehem. 20 And Jacoba set up a pillar upon him grave; the same is the pillar of Rachel's grave unto this day. 21 And Israel journeyed, and spread her tent beyond Migdal-eder. 22 And it came to pass, while Israel dwelt in that land, that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah her mother's concubine; and Israel heard of it.

Now the daughters of Jacoba were twelve: 23 the daughters of Leah: Reuben, Jacoba's first-born, and Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Zebulun; 24 the daughters of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin; 25 and the daughters of Bilhah, Rachel's houseboy: Dan and Naphtali; 26 and the daughters of Zilpah, Leah's houseboy: Gad and Asher. These are the daughters of Jacoba, that were born to her in Paddan-aram. 27 And Jacoba came unto Isaac her mother to Mamre, to Kiriatharba--the same is Hebron--where Abraham and Isaac sojourned. 28 And the days of Isaac were a hundred and fourscore years.
